entry.et: Middle English of, from Old English of

def.dt: :from a place or position march off
:away from land ship stood off to sea
:at a distance in space or time stood 10 paces off a long way off
:from a course :aside turned off into a bypath
:away from the wind
:into an unconscious state dozed off
:so as to be separated from support rolled to the edge of the table and off or close contact blew the lid off the handle came off
:so as to be divided surface marked off into squares
:to a state of discontinuance or suspension shut off an engine

dt.un: used as an intensifier drink off a glass finish it off

def.dt: :in absence from or suspension of regular work or service take time off for lunch
:offstage

dt.un: used as a function word to indicate physical separation or distance from a position of rest, attachment, or union take it off the table a path off the main walk a shop just off the main street

def.dt: :to seaward of two miles off shore
:from the possession or charge of had his wallet stolen off him

dt.un: used as a function word to indicate the object of an action borrowed a dollar off him dined off oysters
used as a function word to indicate the suspension of an occupation or activity off duty off liquor

def.dt: :below the usual standard or level of off his game
:seaward
:right
:more removed or distant the off side of the building
:started on the way off on a spree
:not taking place or staying in effect :canceled the deal was off
:not operating
:not placed so as to permit operation
:not corresponding to fact :incorrect off in his reckoning
:poor subnormal
:not entirely sane :eccentric
:remote slight an off chance
:spent off duty reading on his off days
:marked by a periodic decline in activity or business traveled in the off season for lower prices
:off-color
:inferior off grade of oil
:affected with putrefaction
:down stocks were off
:circumstanced worse off
:to go away :depart used chiefly as an imperative off, or I'll shoot
:kill murder
office; officer; official
:competition :contest bake-off
:with periodic cessation :intermittently rained off and on all day
:not identified with a major brand name off–brand sneakers

entry.et: from its usually being produced in smaller theaters outside of the Broadway theatrical district

def.dt: :a part of the New York professional theater stressing fundamental and artistic values and formerly engaging in experimentation
:not having the right or standard color
:being out of sorts
:of doubtful propriety :dubious
:verging on the indecent off–color remarks
